name: Serial
description: This module allows you to connect Gladys to an arduino to receive and emit data !
instructionsHTML:
This module needs Gladys >= 3.0.0.

Installation

To install this module, you need to :

  • Install this module in Gladys
  • Reboot Gladys
  • Connect your arduino in USB to your Raspberry Pi. Your arduino needs to have the code loaded to handle the application you wants to setup, either data emission or data reception. To handle 433Mhz signal reception, you can use this arduino code. To emit 433Mhz signals, you have the radioemitter module made by a member of the community here.
  • Click on the "Config" button in the "Modules" view to start the detection of your arduino.
  • That's all !
instructionsMarkDown:
This module needs Gladys >= 3.0.0.

###Installation

To install this module, you need to :
- Install this module in Gladys
- Reboot Gladys
- Connect your arduino in USB to your Raspberry Pi. Your arduino needs to have the code loaded to handle the application you wants to setup, either data emission or data reception. To handle 433Mhz signal reception, you can use [this arduino code](https://github.com/GladysProject/Gladys-arduino/blob/master/Receive.ino). To emit 433Mhz signals, you have the radioemitter module made by a member of the community [here](https://developer.gladysproject.com/en/modules/radioemitter).
- Click on the "Config" button in the "Modules" view to start the detection of your arduino.
- That's all !
